People: Martin Luther, John Calvin, Henry VIII
Effects: Reformers gain independence; challenged traditional church practices
Changes: New orientation of faith, imperial religious institutions
Motivations: Personal and political freedoms, establishment of Reformation doctrine
Significance: Establishment of Protestant Christianity, diminishing of Catholic power
Consequences: Expansion of Protestant doctrine; weakening of Catholic sector
Results: Split of Christendom, new religious freedoms
Impacts: Tension between Protestant and Catholic nations, emergence of new Christian teachings
